result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Br. 17

8:49 AM Defendant Daemon M Hanna appeared by video, in custody in Rock County Jail.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Daemon M Hanna.  Attorney Frank J. Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls witness officer A. P. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Remington with direct. DE informs court he cannot hear courtroom audio. Court takes recess to fix audio. Back on the record, Atty. Idlas logs into zoom, DE waives right to see persons in courtroom. Court proceeds without video, but moves courtroom camera to witness for DE to view witness. Court restarts hearing. 

State calls witness officer A. P. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Remington with direct. Witness identified DE on zoom via court reporter's laptop. Atty. Idlas with cross. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC for Bindover to branch.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
